intro: Linaria kavirensis, commonly known as the Kavir Mountains flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Linaria kavirensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh environment.
